comment: The dimensional volume of a 1-dimensional half-open interval is less than or equal the generalized sum of the dimensional volumes of countable half-open intervals that cover it. This is the nonempty, finite generalized sum, sub case in Lemma 114B of [Fremlin1] p. 23. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 21-Nov-2020.)
